[[Louisville Cardinals football|Louisville Cardinals]] |- | '''Originated''' | 1929 |- | '''Trophy Series''' | Cincinnati leads, 30-20-1http://www.cfbdatawarehouse.com/data/div_ia/bigeast/cincinnati/opponents_records.php?teamid=1804 |- | '''Longest UC Win Streak''' | 12 (1929â1969) |- | '''Longest UL Win Streak''' | 5 (2003â2007) |- | '''Current Holder''' | Cincinnati |- | colspan="2" align="center"|
|- | align="center" style="width:13em" | [[Image:Cincinnati University Bearcats textlogo.svg|110px|Cincinnati logo]] | align="center" style="width:13em" | [[File:Louisville scipt L logo.png|110px|Louisville logo]] |} '''The Keg of Nails''' is a traveling trophy in [[college football]], awarded to the winner of the Universities of [[Louisville University|Louisville]] and [[Cincinnati University|Cincinnati]] (which are now connected by [[Interstate 71]]) since [[1929]]. Known more for an intense [[basketball]] rivalry and tradition, the Universities of [[University of Louisville|Louisville]] and [[University of Cincinnati|Cincinnati]] have a [[American football|football]] rivalry that has stretched over the span of 3 conferences from the [[Missouri Valley Conference]], to [[Conference USA]], and more recently in the [[Big East Conference]]. It is believed to be the oldest rivalry for the University of Louisville football team and the second oldest for Cincinnati, only behind the annual game with the [[Miami RedHawks]]. The trophy is a replica of a keg used to ship nails. The exchange is believed to have been initiated by fraternity chapters on the UC and UofL campuses, signifying that the winning players in the game were "tough as nails." The present keg is actually a replacement for the original award, which was misplaced by Louisville, lost during some construction of office facilities. It is adorned with the logos of both schools and the scores of the series games. ==Game results== ''Cincinnati victories are shaded ââ black. Louisville victories are shaded ââ red.
